ocaml/tools/pre-commit-githook - ocaml

Functions defined

  • not_pruned

Source code

  1. #!/usr/bin/env bash
  2. #**************************************************************************
  3. #*                                                                        *
  4. #*                                 OCaml                                  *
  5. #*                                                                        *
  6. #*                David Allsopp, MetaStack Solutions Ltd.                 *
  7. #*                                                                        *
  8. #*   Copyright 2017 MetaStack Solutions Ltd.                              *
  9. #*                                                                        *
  10. #*   All rights reserved.  This file is distributed under the terms of    *
  11. #*   the GNU Lesser General Public License version 2.1, with the          *
  12. #*   special exception on linking described in the file LICENSE.          *
  13. #*                                                                        *
  14. #**************************************************************************

  16. # Bump this on any changes. It's vital that HOOK_VERSION followed by equals
  17. # appears nowhere else in these sources!
  18. HOOK_VERSION=6

  20. # For what it's worth, allow for empty trees!
  21. if git rev-parse --verify HEAD >/dev/null 2>&1
  22. then
  23.   against=HEAD
  24. else
  25.   # Initial commit: diff against an empty tree object
  26.   against=4b825dc642cb6eb9a060e54bf8d69288fbee4904
  27. fi

  29. # Redirect output to stderr.
  30. exec 1>&2

  32. # Check to see if the script's been updated
  33. if git ls-files --error-unmatch tools/pre-commit-githook >/dev/null 2>&1 ; then
  34.   THEIR_VERSION=$(git cat-file --textconv HEAD:tools/pre-commit-githook \
  35.                     | sed -ne 's/^HOOK_VERSION=//p')
  36.   if [[ -n $THEIR_VERSION && $THEIR_VERSION -gt $HOOK_VERSION ]] ; then
  37.     echo "Note: tools/pre-commit-githook is newer than .git/hooks/pre-commit"
  38.     echo "      You may wish to update your local githook"
  39.   fi
  40. fi

  42. # Git's built-in mechanism for whitespace is neater than ours, so do it first.
  43. # The strange construction below creates a list of files which have either
  44. # white-at-eol or white-at-eof included in ocaml-typo in .gitattributes and by
  45. # prefixing the names with :! causes git diff-index to skip over them.
  46. if [[ -n $(git diff-index --cached --name-only $against) ]] ; then
  47.   FILES=$(git diff-index --cached --name-only $against \
  48.           | xargs git check-attr --cached ocaml-typo \
  49.           | sed -ne 's/\(.*\): ocaml-typo:.*[ ,]white-at-eo[fl]\(,\|$\)/:!\1/p')
  50.   if ! git diff-index --check --cached $against -- $FILES ; then
  51.     exit 1
  52.   fi
  53. else
  54.   exit 0
  55. fi

  57. # Test to see if any part of the directory name has been marked prune
  58. ‌not_pruned () {
  59.   DIR=$(dirname "$1")
  60.   if [ "$DIR" = "." ] ; then
  61.     return 0
  62.   else
  63.     case ",$(git check-attr typo.prune "$DIR" | sed -e 's/.*: //')," in
  64.       ,set,)
  65.       return 1
  66.       ;;
  67.       *)

  69.       not_pruned "$DIR"
  70.       return $?
  71.     esac
  72.   fi
  73. }

  75. # Now run check-typo over all the files in the index
  76. STATUS=0
  77. export OCAML_CT_PREFIX=:
  78. export OCAML_CT_CAT="git cat-file --textconv"
  79. export OCAML_CT_CA_FLAG=--cached
  80. while IFS= read -r path
  81. do
  82.   if not_pruned "$path" && ! tools/check-typo "./$path" ; then
  83.     STATUS=1
  84.   fi
  85. done < <(git diff --diff-filter=d --staged --name-only)

  87. # If any files affecting the generation of configure have been updated, test
  88. # whether the index includes an up-to-date configure script.
  89. # See also tools/ci/actions/check-configure.sh

  91. AUTOCONF_FILES=\
  92. 'configure configure.ac aclocal.m4 build-aux/* '\
  93. 'tools/autogen tools/git-dev-options.sh'

  95. # Convert $AUTOCONF_FILES to a BRE
  96. PATHS="${AUTOCONF_FILES//./\\.}"
  97. PATHS="${PATHS//\*/.*}"
  98. PATHS="${PATHS// /\\|}"

  100. OVERRIDE_MESSAGE='(you can override githooks with git-commit --no-verify)'
  101. WRONG_AUTOCONF=0

  103. if git diff --diff-filter=d --staged --name-only | grep -qx "$PATHS" ; then
  104.   # Get the AC_PREREQ line in configure.ac for the required autoconf version
  105.   PREREQ="$(git cat-file --textconv :configure.ac \
  106.               | sed -ne 's/^AC_PREREQ(\[\(.*\)\])/\1/p')"
  107.   if [[ -z $PREREQ ]]; then
  108.     echo 'Unable to find/parse the AC_PREREQ macro in configure.ac'
  109.     echo 'This line should be of the form AC_PREREQ([2.69])'
  110.     echo '(with no whitespace or comment)'
  111.     STATUS=1
  112.   else
  113.     # Check for autoconf and its version
  114.     AUTOCONF_TOOL='autoconf'
  115.     # Check version of autoconf
  116.     set -o pipefail
  117.     AUTOCONF_VERSION="$($AUTOCONF_TOOL --version 2>/dev/null | head -n 1)"
  118.     if [[ $? -ne 0 ]]; then
  119.       echo 'Files affecting configure updated, but autoconf not found'
  120.       echo 'Unable to verify that configure is up-to-date'
  121.       echo "$OVERRIDE_MESSAGE"
  122.       STATUS=1
  123.     else
  124.       AUTOCONF_VERSION="${AUTOCONF_VERSION##* }"
  125.       if [[ $AUTOCONF_VERSION != $PREREQ ]]; then
  126.         # Found autoconf, but it's the wrong version. If it's older,
  127.         # tools/autogen will fail. If it's newer, it may succeed, but CI may
  128.         # fail. autoconf is frequently available at an exact version, so try
  129.         # the two known names for it.
  130.         for tool in $AUTOCONF_TOOL-$PREREQ $AUTOCONF_TOOL$PREREQ; do
  131.           VERSION="$($tool --version 2>/dev/null | head -n 1)"
  132.           if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
  133.             VERSION="${VERSION##* }"
  134.             if [[ $VERSION != $PREREQ ]]; then
  135.               continue
  136.             fi
  137.           else
  138.             continue
  139.           fi
  140.           echo "autoconf has version $AUTOCONF_VERSION; using $tool instead"
  141.           AUTOCONF_TOOL="$tool"
  142.           AUTOCONF_VERSION="$VERSION"
  143.           break
  144.         done
  145.       fi

  147.       if [[ $AUTOCONF_VERSION != $PREREQ ]]; then
  148.         # We're using the wrong version of autoconf: if all other tests succeed,
  149.         # display a warning that CI may complain (CI uses the version specified
  150.         # by AC_PREREQ).
  151.         WRONG_AUTOCONF=1
  152.       fi

  154.       # Checkout the relevant files from the index to a temporary directory to
  155.       # test them.
  156.       BUILD_DIR="$(mktemp -d)"
  157.       BUILD_DIR="${BUILD_DIR%%/}/"
  158.       if [[ -z $BUILD_DIR ]]; then
  159.         echo 'Unable to create a temporary directory to test configure.ac'
  160.         STATUS=1
  161.       else
  162.         git checkout-index --prefix "$BUILD_DIR" -- $AUTOCONF_FILES
  163.         pushd "$BUILD_DIR" > /dev/null
  164.         mkdir -p a b
  165.         mv configure a/
  166.         echo 'Regenerating configure...'
  167.         if tools/autogen "$AUTOCONF_TOOL"; then
  168.           mv configure b/
  169.           if diff a/configure b/configure > /dev/null; then
  170.             if ((WRONG_AUTOCONF)); then
  171.               echo '*** Warning! configure.ac generates the configure script'
  172.               echo "*** However, this is using autoconf $AUTOCONF_VERSION"
  173.               echo "*** configure.ac requires autoconf $PREREQ; the CI check on"
  174.               echo '*** GitHub may fail.'
  175.             fi
  176.           else
  177.             echo 'configure.ac does not appear to generate configure'
  178.             echo 'Try running make -B configure and stage the changes'
  179.             echo "$OVERRIDE_MESSAGE"
  180.             git diff --text --no-index a b
  181.             STATUS=1
  182.           fi
  183.         else
  184.           echo 'tools/autogen failed'
  185.           STATUS=1
  186.         fi
  187.         popd > /dev/null
  188.         rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR"
  189.       fi
  190.     fi
  191.   fi
  192. fi

  194. exit $STATUS
